issue.title: [BUG] invalid keras import in tests (for some versions)

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
It seems like there's some inconsistencies with keras imports between keras versions.
Looking at the toml file I don't see any bounds on the versions. 

In any case I'm on keras 2.8 and the following import in sktime/classification/tests/test_base.py raises an import error:
`from keras.optimizers import Adamax`

This causes the tests to fail during collection, which is annoying (especially for the VS code testing functionality)
to test that without running all the tests you can do: `pytest --collect-only .`

doing some debugging I found that the right import for my case is: 
`from keras.optimizer_v2.adamax import Adamax`

The 2 ways to resolve this (I suggest we do both):
- Add version bounds to avoid this in the future (also why are we using keras and not tensorflow.keras ?)
- move the import inside the test as it's a soft dependency anyway

issue.title: [ENH] one-time pre-release diagnostics

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
This issue is about introducing, and discussing the best way to introduce, pre-release diagnostics.

Example: we want that the full test suite runs without soft dependencies, but we are not testing that in our regular CI (as this would multiplicate the CI runs).

We may want to run it before each release though and/or fix arising maintenance issues, such as soft dependency isolation.

Ways we could do this:

* make it part of the release GHA workflow
* make it part of the release *process*, and the release manager has to manually trigger the workflow

2nd option increases process complexity and cognitive load on the release manager, but prevents having to reset tag and retrigger the release workflow.

Any other options I am missing?
FYI @ltsaprounis, @lmmentel, @aiwalter, @GuzalBulatova 

Related issues: #3743, #3748 (bug not detected, missing soft dep isolation)

issue.title: [MNT] test soft dependency isolation in non-suite tests

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
This PR partially addresses #3748 in a systematic manner by adding a CI element which runs all non-suite tests without soft dependencies.

If these are not properly isolated, then test collection or individual tests will fail.

This should catch the current issues mentioned in #3748.

Relies on https://github.com/sktime/sktime/pull/3760 where the remaining problems are being fixed.

issue.title: [MNT] isolate soft dependencies in tests

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
Fixes https://github.com/sktime/sktime/issues/3748

Isolates soft dependencies in tests discovered via https://github.com/sktime/sktime/pull/3750

body:
you can use `_check_soft_dependencies` to return a boolean already, no try/except needed

Didn't know about `importorskip`, seems very useful!
